meanings.definition: A large area of ice, typically formed by the merging of several glaciers.
meanings.sent1: The icefields stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent2: Explorers marveled at the vast icefields in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The penguins held a dance party on the icefields.
meanings.sent4: The icefields were a frozen kingdom waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering icefields sparkled under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The region of a glacier where the ice is in motion.
meanings.sent1: Hikers cautiously navigated the icy paths of the icefields.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the movement patterns of the icefields.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream truck got stuck in the icefields!
meanings.sent4: The icefields whispered secrets of ancient times.
meanings.sent5: The icefields danced and swirled like a frozen river.
